name: places/ChIJAeIAtw_2wokRtRlR9m-LG8c
adrFormatAddress: 1432 5th Ave, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text:
They killed my mom!!!
At a doctor visit for a mammogram in 2016, a lump was found on my mom’s breast. Archcare did nothing, told us nothing, and never followed up with biopsies or further treatment. We always called for updates on my mom’s care and we’re always told everything was ok. As my mom’s primary care doctor, they were the only ones who could further her treatment. We trusted them with our precious mom’s care and they failed her and us. My mom passed away from stage 4 breast cancer on Mother’s Day 2019. If they would’ve done the right thing in 2016, our mom would have survived this horrible disease. We will keep fighting to shut this place down and keep another family from suffering they way we are suffering. I wish I could give them 0 stars, but the system will not allow me!!!

originalText.text:
With great concern, I advise to stay away. The coordinator of their transportation division has no concern for the well-being and safety of their clients. I speak from personal experience when I tell you. My family, along with other clients have been mistreated, belittled, verbally abused and placed in harm's way. When we begged and pleaded, on our hands and knees on numerous occasions. Nothing, absolutely nothing has been done. This woman continues to outright do as she pleases with no regard, respect nor concern for anyone.
Please advise anyone you know, who may be considering attending this location. To seek a more suitable, accommodating and caring program.

originalText.text: I've been here for over a month. The doctors nursing staff and everybody else at this institution should be commended. It working very hard to attend to everyone's needs. I can see that they're overworked and tired. God bless them. I read some of the reviews and I don't agree. Robert McCauley a patient
